info.title: System API
info.description: The `System` plugin is used to manage various system-level features such as power settings and firmware updates.

seconds.summary: The deep sleep timeout in seconds

userAgent.example: Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; x86_64 GNU/Linux) AppleWebKit/601.1 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/8.0 Safari/601.1 WPE

cacheContains.summary:
Checks if a key is present in the cache.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

clearLastDeepSleepReason.summary:
Clears the last deep sleep reason.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

deletePersistentPath.summary:
(Version 2) Deletes persistent path associated with a callsign.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

callsign.description: Callsign of the service to delete persistent path

type.description: The type of execution environment. (can be used instead of callsign)

enableMoca.summary:
Enables (or disables) Moca support for the platform.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

value.summary: `true` to enable Moca support or `false` to disable Moca support.

enableXREConnectionRetention.summary:
Enables (or disables) XRE Connection Retention option.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

enable.summary: `true` to enable XRE connection retention or `false` to disable.

fireFirmwarePendingReboot.summary:
(Version 2) Notifies the device about a pending reboot.
 
### Events 
| Event | Description | 
| :----------- | :----------- |
| `onFirmwarePendingReboot` | Triggers when the firmware has a pending reboot |

getAvailableStandbyModes.summary:
Queries the available standby modes.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

getCachedValue.summary:
Gets the value of a key in the cache.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

sampleKey.summary: Value for the specified key name

getCoreTemperature.summary:
Returns the core temperature of the device. Not supported on all devices.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

getDeviceInfo.summary:
Collects device details. Sample keys include:  
* bluetooth_mac  
* boxIP  
* build_type  
* estb_mac  
* imageVersion  
* rf4ce_mac  
* wifi_mac.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

params.summary: A list of supported device keys

estb_mac.summary: Value for the specified key name

getDownloadedFirmwareInfo.summary:
Returns information about firmware downloads.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

downloadedFWLocation.summary: The location of the downloaded firmware

isRebootDeferred.summary: Whether the device should be rebooted

getFirmwareDownloadPercent.summary:
Gets the current download percentage.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

getFirmwareUpdateInfo.summary:
Checks the firmware update information.
 
### Events 
| Event | Description | 
| :----------- | :----------- |
| `onFirmwareUpdateInfoReceived` | Triggers when the firmware update information is requested |

getFirmwareUpdateState.summary:
Checks the state of the firmware update.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

getLastDeepSleepReason.summary:
Retrieves the last deep sleep reason.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

getLastFirmwareFailureReason.summary:
(Version 2) Retrieves the last firmware failure reason.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

failReason.example: Image Download Failed - Unable to connect

getLastWakeupKeyCode.summary:
(Version 2) Returns the last wakeup keycode.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

getMacAddresses.summary:
Gets the MAC address of the device.
 
### Events 
| Event | Description | 
| :----------- | :----------- |
| `onMacAddressesRetreived` | Triggers when the MAC addresses are requested |

getMfgSerialNumber.summary:
Gets the Manufacturing Serial Number.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

getMilestones.summary:
Returns the list of milestones.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

items.example: 2020 Jan 28 08:24:06.762355 arrisxi6 systemd[1]: Starting Log RDK Started Service...

getMode.summary:
Returns the currently set mode information.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

getNetworkStandbyMode.summary:
Returns the network standby mode of the device. If network standby is `true`, the device supports `WakeOnLAN` and `WakeOnWLAN` actions in STR (S3) mode.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

getOvertempGraceInterval.summary:
Returns the over-temperature grace interval value. Not supported on all devices.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

getPlatformConfiguration.summary:
(Version 2) Returns the supported features and device/account info.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

query.description: Query for support of a particular feature, e.g. AccountInfo.accountId

getPowerState.summary:
Returns the power state of the device.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

getPowerStateBeforeReboot.summary:
Returns the power state before reboot.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

getPowerStateIsManagedByDevice.summary:
Checks whether the power state is managed by the device.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

powerStateManagedByDevice.summary: `true` if power state is managed by the device, `false` otherwise

getPreferredStandbyMode.summary:
Returns the preferred standby mode. This method returns an empty string if the preferred mode has not been set.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

getPreviousRebootInfo.summary:
Returns basic information about a reboot.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

getPreviousRebootInfo2.summary:
Returns detailed information about a reboot.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

lastHardPowerReset.summary: The timestamp of the last hard power reset

getPreviousRebootReason.summary:
Returns the last reboot reason.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

getRFCConfig.summary:
Returns information that is related to RDK Feature Control (RFC) configurations.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

rfcList.summary: A list of RFC properties to query

RFCConfig.summary: A list of specified RFC properties

getSerialNumber.summary:
Returns the device serial number.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

getStateInfo.summary:
Queries device state information of various properties.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

param.summary: The property to query as a string

getStoreDemoLink.summary:
(Version 2) Returns the store demo video link.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

fileURL.summary: The file URL of stored demo video

getSystemVersions.summary:
Returns system version details.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

getTemperatureThresholds.summary:
Returns temperature threshold values. Not supported on all devices.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

getTerritory.summary:
Gets the configured system territory and region. Territory is a ISO-3166-1 alpha-3 standard (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1). Region is a ISO-3166-2 alpha-2 standard (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2).
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

getTimeZones.summary:
(Version2) Gets the available timezones from the system's time zone database. This method is useful for determining time offsets per zone.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

getTimeZoneDST.summary:
Get the configured time zone from the file referenced by `TZ_FILE`. If the time zone is not set, then `null` is returned.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

getWakeupReason.summary:
(Version 2) Returns the reason for the device coming out of deep sleep.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

getXconfParams.summary:
Returns XCONF configuration parameters for the device.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

eStbMac.summary: The embedded set-top box MAC address

hasRebootBeenRequested.summary:
Checks whether a reboot has been requested.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

rebootRequested.summary: `true` if a reboot has been requested, otherwise `false`

isGzEnabled.summary:
Checks whether GZ is enabled.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

isOptOutTelemetry.summary:
Checks the telemetry opt-out status.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

queryMocaStatus.summary:
Checks whether MOCA is enabled.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

reboot.summary:
Requests that the system performs a reboot of the set-top box.
 
### Events 
| Event | Description | 
| :----------- | :----------- |
| `onRebootRequest` | Triggers when a device reboot request is made |

removeCacheKey.summary:
Removes the cache key.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

requestSystemUptime.summary:
Returns the device uptime.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

systemUptime.summary: The uptime, in seconds, of the device

setBootLoaderPattern.summary:
Sets the boot loader pattern mode in MFR. 
### Events
 
 No Events.

setCachedValue.summary:
Sets the value for a key in the cache.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

setDeepSleepTimer.summary:
Sets the deep sleep timeout period.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

setFirmwareAutoReboot.summary:
(Version 2) Enables or disables the AutoReboot Feature. This method internally sets the tr181 `AutoReboot.Enable` parameter to `true` or `false`.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

enable.summary: `true` to enable Autoreboot or `false` to disable

setFirmwareRebootDelay.summary:
(Version 2) Delays the firmware reboot.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

setGzEnabled.summary:
Enables or disables GZ.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

setMode.summary:
Sets the mode of the set-top box for a specific duration before returning to normal mode. Valid modes are:  
* `NORMAL` - The set-top box is operating in normal mode.  
* `EAS` - The set-top box is operating in Emergency Alert System (EAS) mode. This mode is set when the device needs to perform certain tasks when entering EAS mode, such as setting the clock display or preventing the user from using the diagnostics menu.  
* `WAREHOUSE` - The set-top box is operating in warehouse mode.
 
### Events 
| Event | Description | 
| :----------- | :----------- |
| `onSystemModeChanged` | Triggers when the system mode is changed successfully |

setNetworkStandbyMode.summary:
Enables or disables the network standby mode of the device. If network standby is enabled, the device supports `WakeOnLAN` and `WakeOnWLAN` actions in STR (S3) mode.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

setOptOutTelemetry.summary:
Sets the telemetry opt-out status.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

setOvertempGraceInterval.summary:
Sets the over-temperature grace interval value. Not supported on all devices.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

setPowerState.summary:
Sets the power state of the device.
 
### Events 
| Event | Description | 
| :----------- | :----------- |
| `onSystemPowerStateChanged` | Triggers when the system power state changes |

standbyReason.summary: The reason for a standby state

setPreferredStandbyMode.summary:
Sets and persists the preferred standby mode. See [getAvailableStandbyModes](#getAvailableStandbyModes) for valid modes. Invoking this function does not change the power state of the device. It only sets the user preference for the preferred action when the [setPowerState](#setPowerState) method is invoked with a value of `STANDBY`.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

setTemperatureThresholds.summary:
Sets the temperature threshold values. Not supported on all devices.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

setTerritory.summary:
Sets the system territory and region.Territory is a ISO-3166-1 alpha-3 standard (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1). Region is a ISO-3166-2 alpha-2 standard (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2).
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

setTimeZoneDST.summary:
Sets the system time zone. See `getTimeZones` to get a list of available timezones on the system.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

setWakeupSrcConfiguration.summary:
Sets the wakeup source configuration.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

updateFirmware.summary:
Initiates a firmware update. This method has no affect if an update is not available.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

uploadLogs.summary:
(Version 2) Uploads logs to a URL returned by SSR.
 
### Events
 
 No Events.

onFirmwarePendingReboot.summary: (Version 2) Triggered when the `fireFirmwarePendingReboot` method is invoked

onFirmwareUpdateInfoReceived.summary:
Triggered when the `getFirmwareUpdateInfo` asynchronous method is invoked.  
Update details are:  
* `0` - A new firmware version is available.  
* `1` - The firmware version is at the current version.  
* `2` - XCONF did not return a firmware version (timeout or other XCONF error).  
* `3` - The device is configured not to update the firmware (`swupdate.conf` exists on the device)

rebootImmediately.summary: The value `true` indicates that the device has to be rebooted immediately or `false` otherwise

updateAvailable.summary: The value `false` indicates that there is no update available, either because there was no firmware update version returned from XCONF, or because the version returned from XCONF matches the version already on the device. The value of `true` indicates there is a firmware version available for update.

onFirmwareUpdateStateChange.summary:
Triggered when the state of a firmware update changes.  
State details are:  
* `0`: Uninitialized - there is no firmware update in progress  
* `1`: Requesting - requesting firmware update information  
* `2`: Downloading  
* `3`: Failed  
* `4`: Download Complete  
* `5`: Validation Complete  
* `6`: Preparing to Reboot

onMacAddressesRetreived.summary: Triggered when the `getMacAddresses` asynchronous method is invoked

ecm_mac.summary: The embedded cable modem MAC address

estb_mac.summary: The embedded set-top box MAC address

info.summary: Additional information (only if any of the above data is missing)
info.example: Details fetch: all are not success

onNetworkStandbyModeChanged.summary: Triggered when the network standby mode setting changes

onRebootRequest.summary: Triggered when an application invokes the reboot method

onSystemClockSet.summary: Triggered when the clock on the set-top device is updated

onSystemModeChanged.summary: Triggered when the device operating mode changes

onSystemPowerStateChanged.summary: Triggered when the power manager detects a device power state change

onTemperatureThresholdChanged.summary: Triggered when the device temperature changes beyond the `WARN` or `MAX` limits (see `setTemperatureThresholds`). Not supported on all devices.

exceeded.summary: Whether the threshold exceeded the configured value
